oai_dc:dc.dc:title: MEAN FLUX IN THE FREE SURFACE ZONE OF WATER WAVES IN A CLOSED WAVE FLUME
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Cieslikiewicz, Witold
Gudmestad, Ove T.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: mean flux
free surface
wave flume
closed flume
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper presents some results of research relating to the theoretical predictions of mass-transport velocity within the free surface zone of water waves in intermediate water depth. The theoretical results are compared with measurements made in a wave flume. The theoretical estimate of a mean drift has allowed for a better estimation of the return flow in the wave flume. Examples of such estimation are given and graphically presented in the paper. Finally, the stability of the obtained mean velocity profiles throught the experiments is examined.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 24 (1994): Proceedings of 24th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Kobe, Japan, 1994.
